name: 郭若妤
objective: This course introduces the theories and practical applications of human factors and Kansei engineering, emphasising their significant roles in product design and human machine interfaces. Students will learn how to systematically evaluate the affective aspects of products, services, and systems to meet user requirements and provide an improved user experience.
schedule:
Each week, students will engage in a "Weekly Literature Reading Sharing Discussion," during which they will present and discuss the key findings from their weekly assigned readings. Concurrently, students will design and execute an eye-tracking experiment throughout the course, culminating in a presentation of their findings in the final weeks.

Week 1: Course Introduction - Overview of Human Factors and Kansei Engineering
Week 2: Cognitive Ergonomics - Understanding the Role of Human Cognition in Design
Week 3: User-Centred Design - Principles and Applications
Week 4: Eye Tracking Methodology - Basics and Applications in Ergonomics
Week 5: Emotional Design - Introduction and Principles
Week 6: Human Factors in Systems Design - Concepts and Case Studies
Week 7: Work Design - Cognitive Ergonomics Considerations
Week 8: Introduction to Kansei Engineering - Principles and Historical Perspective
Week 9: Emotional Design in Kansei Engineering - Affective Design Concepts
Week 10: Eye Tracking in Usability Testing - Methodologies and Data Collection
Week 11: Kansei Engineering in Product and Service Design - Case Studies and Challenges
Week 12: Human-Machine Interfaces - Affective Design Considerations
Week 13: Eye Tracking Data Analysis - Techniques and Interpretation
Week 14: Advanced Topics in Human Factors and Kansei Engineering - Emerging Trends and Challenges
Week 15: Eye Tracking Experiment Presentation - Sharing Findings and Discussion
Week 16: Capstone Project Introduction - Overview and Topic Selection
Week 17: Capstone Project Work - Research, Design, and Planning Stage
Week 18: Capstone Project Presentation - Group Presentations and Feedback

Please note that the course schedule is subject to change based on the instructor's discretion, students' progress, and specific class dynamics.
scorePolicy:
Attitude: Punctuality & Initiative (10%), Independence (10%)
Research project capability: Execution & Analysis (15%), Innovation (15%)
Final report: 50%
materials: Holmqvist, K., Nyström, M., Andersson, R., Dewhurst, R., Jarodzka, H., & Van de Weijer, J. (2011). Eye tracking: A comprehensive guide to methods and measures. OUP Oxford.
